posts.post_content:
This is the remainder of my t206 collection (with the exception of a red hindu) - listed to pay for uni. fees. 

Due to my location (England) I have to charge postage too. 
Postage costs = $5.50 for cards totaling up to $50 , then add $2 for each multiple of $50.
I will respond to emails/post in the thread as quickly as I can but bear in mind I'm five hours in front of EST

Edited to add - PAYPAL ONLY

List:

Martin-I would reword your postage costs, at first it sounded like postage was going to be $50...

[quote name="mintacular" post=852139]Martin-I would reword your postage costs, at first it sounded like postage was going to be $50...[/QUOTE]

Thanks for the heads-up!

Payment sent for the T206 Zach Wheat PSA 4. Thanks Martin!
Jeff
All the best with the sale, Martin - sad to see the whole collection go! You've always been a real pleasure to deal with.

[quote name="T206.org" post=852160]All the best with the sale, Martin - sad to see the whole collection go! You've always been a real pleasure to deal with.[/QUOTE]

Trae,

Thanks for the kind words. Its a temporary thing - I started a masters degree with the goal of getting a more interesting and better paid job. These cards will pay for my  remaining tuition fees but I'll be back!!!!!! 

Take care
Martin

Martin,

Good luck with the sale and all the best with your future endeavours.
Wow. I didn't know you had all those cards. Quite a collection.

Hi Martin,

Just wanted to wish you well with your sale and your academic pursuits.

And, since it's the Ashes, I wanted to say it was very impressive to see England pull off the draw in the Brisbane Test, especially the top order stands with Cook's double century in the second innings!.  Hope they carry the momentum into the 2nd Test. 

Always best regards from across the pond,
Craig

I'm sad to have to let them go - but give me 12 months and I'll be back.

Thanks Tim - glad to see you're still working on your collection!

Chris - this is about 80 less than I had :(

Craig - England dominated days 4 and 5 in Brisbane - and are looking pretty good after day one in Adelaide (the best batting wicket in Australia - Australia should be scoring 450+ on it).
